components.description:
An octopus, a sea animal with eight legs, known to change color and release ink. Generally depicted as a pink or orange octopus facing forward, with a large, round head, prominent eyes, and its tentacle-like arms raised at its sides. Platforms vary in the number of arms shown, ranging from four to the full eight, with several designs featuring suckers on them.

Not to be confused with ü¶ë Squid, though their applications may overlap.

Twitter’s octopus is purple. Apple’s has a friendly, cartoon-styled appearance. Google and Samsung’s octopuses previously looked surprised, while Microsoft's suggested an üëæ Alien Monster.

title: Octopus

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Animal symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: An octopus emoji, with two eyes and¬†eight tentacles. Between 3 and 6 of the tentacles are shown in most versions of this emoji. Shown in pin http://emojipedia.org/octopus/
emoji_net_data.name: octopus

bn:00026737n: The octopus is a cephalopod mollusc of the order Octopoda.
Bottom-living cephalopod having a soft oval body with eight long tentacles
A cephalopod mollusc of the Octopodidae family, characterized by its eight tentacles.

bn:00069946n: The sea, the world ocean, or simply the ocean, is the connected body of salty water that covers 70.8% of the Earth's surface.
A large body of salty water. (Major seas are known as oceans.)
A sea is a large body of saline water usually connected with an ocean.
A division of an ocean or a large body of salt water partially enclosed by land
The body of water covering most of Earth
A body of salt water that is smaller than an ocean and generally in proximity to a continent.

bn:00014632n: Squid is a popular food in many parts of the world.
Squid as food, especially cooked in the form of calamari rings

bn:00009263n: A lat, narrow strip of sand, gravel or pebbles along the shoreline of a body of water (ocean, river, lake).
An area of sand sloping down to the water of a sea or lake
A beach is a landform along the coast of an ocean, sea, lake, or river.
The shore of a body of water, especially when sandy or pebbly.
Landform along the shoreline of an ocean, sea, lake, or river

bn:00058574n: The oceans, seas, bays, estuaries, and other major water bodies, including coastal marine and nearshore zones.
The mass of water occupying all of the Earth's surface not occupied by land, but excluding all lakes and inland seas.
Oceans are major bodies of saline water, and the principal component of the hydrosphere.
A large body of water constituting a principal part of the hydrosphere
An ocean is a body of saline water that composes much of a planet's hydrosphere.

apple_vendor_description: Apple‚Äôs octopus emoji is a masterclass in smooth, rounded design, featuring a plump, bulbous head and elegantly curved tentacles that seem to gracefully undulate. Its deep purple or bluish hue is enhanced by Apple‚Äôs realistic lighting and subtle highlights, giving it a friendly yet intriguing appearance. On Apple devices, this creature evokes the mysteries of the deep sea, complex situations, or the idea of being overwhelmed, all with a touch of playful charm.
